revised_title: Electromagnetic Effects in the Theory of Shells and Plates
tldr: This article explores the electromagnetic effects in the theory of shells and plates, focusing on the nonlinear and linear theories of deformable shell-like bodies. The authors develop a thermomechanical theory of shells that accounts for electromagnetic and thermal effects, using a two-dimensional continuum model known as Cosserat surfaces. They discuss various applications of the theory, including piezoelectric plates and elastic wave guides.
